subject: Re: Next 820/goldBox Installment
author: wgungfu
full_text:
Thanks for the input on your personal experience Steve.  I'm still
going to try that and several other methods though.  The iPod method I
was talking about is no different than a standard EVPMaker attempt
(which a lot of people mention great success with).  Just playing the
chopped up file from an iPod instead of on the computer.

Marty

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Marty,
> 
> I tried the IPOD thing a year ago and came to the conclusion that 
> they need a live feed for communicating.  Not for messages, but real-
> time back and forth stuff.
> 
> -Steve H.
> 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "wgungfu" <wgungfu3@> wrote:
> >
> > Andy, thanks for the compliments, much appreciated.  Main credit
> > should of course go to Frank though, he provided the main roadwork 
> and
> > inspiration.  My main concern design wise for this was to have a
> > version that was compartmentalized ("plug and play" if you will) so
> > that components can be easily substituted for experimenting.  Plus
> > something lower powered to make it more portable, hence the idea to
> > use a low power speaker powered by the input device, and a
> > corresponding hearing assistance device as the mic/amp to amp it 
> up. 
> > Once the lid is on, this thing is *loud* but clear.  In fact, I have
> > the amp set to min volume and its still a little to loud to listen 
> to
> > with headphones sometimes unless you play around with equalizing the
> > volume settings on the 820 and the speaker.
> > 
> > I'm also going to be experimenting swapping out the 820 with an iPod
> > shuffle containing a lengthy pre-recorded sound file of audio.  30
> > second talk (maybe me reading the alphabet or something), chopped up
> > with EVP-Maker, and then spliced out to repeat for 30 minutes or 
> so. 
> > I realize, as Frank stated previously, that they can effect sound
> > anywhere including in a control sound like this as its being 
> recorded
> > or mixed.  But my concern is satisfying the "skeptics" out there 
> who,
> > as you put it when you first joined the group, feel that using the
> > radio input it "would be hard to distinguish from coincidence".  A
> > controlled input that can be referred back to for comparison would
> > satisfy that qualification that keeps getting thrown up. 
> > 
> > Marty
> > 
> > 
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "ourobouros2k2" <ourobouros2k2@> 
> wrote:
> > >
> > > I am loving this design. October hitting me pretty hard but will 
> try
> > > to scare up the jack to implement this design soon. thanks for 
> your
> > > hard work and posting easy-to-follow instructions.
> > > 
> > > thanks again,
> > > Andy
